newsitem.title: CHINA: China to curb fixed asset investment in 1997.
newsitem.headline: China to curb fixed asset investment in 1997.

text.p: China will try to curb fixed asset investment in 1997 to between 2.65 trillion and 2.9 trillion yuan, the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.

China would accelerate investment structure reforms and develop an investment risk mechanism, a project capital system and legal person responsibility system as soon as possible, it quoted Zhang Hanya, deputy head of the State Planning Commission's investment institute, as saying.
State media have forecast that China's fixed asset investment was expected to grow to 2.775 billion yuan ($334.3 billion) in 1997, up by 17.6 percent from 2.36 trillion yuan in 1996.
